Posts.Content:
I had that same issue as well Kimmymay, I still have the mass they think is actually infection they are treating me with antibiotics. If it does not shrink then they are going to remove it just to be safe. If the results are "ok" I am guessing that means it was benign but they want to get it out so there isn't a development of pre-cancer cells or something. Good Luck
Woogie
Posts.Title: Cyst and Mass ????

Posts.Content:
Vita-
I agree it is tough, I did things I really enjoyed doing, I worked on crafts, I did things that would seriously engage my mind. I am a firm believer in the idol hands are the devils workshop. I kept going through all of the horrors of EVERYTHING. But I found as I did things that I had to concentrate on and less to let my mind wander the better it was for me. 
Please keep me updated on how things go for you. Thinking of you often. Sorry it took me a couple days to reply had family in town.
Posts.Title: need some advice

Posts.Content: WOOOOHOOOOO!!!! Celebrate, and enjoy your family! So glad the results turned out well for you. God Bless.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Anxiety--How to Deal with It?

Posts.Content:
I went yesterday for a biopsy on my left breast which 6 days ago the radiologist was very worried about
. However, yesterday during the procedure he looked at it again and said "Huh, that doesn't look the same at all more solid cystic in nature, lets biopsy it just in case." I don't know if this is good news or bad news i am still terrified. Anyone tell me what you would take from that?
Posts.Title: need some advice

Posts.Content:
Vita1,
You will be in my prayers and if you ever need me I check this forum daily and will be happy to exchange emails with you or whatever you might need. God Bless you!!
Posts.Title: Safe to wait a month to biopsy suspiscous spot?

Posts.Content: Update, just got a call from my doctor and it was benign thank my Christmas miracle prayers!!
Posts.Title: need some advice

Posts.Content:
Mimi57 and Vita1,
I too just went through the same thing of waiting a month to find out what was going on with a mass i had behind my nipple on my left breast. The radiologist on his first check of it was "Very Concerned" it is a terrifying experience and made Christmas very difficult. All I can say is have faith in yourself and if it is to big for you hand it off to a religious thought, or perhaps even a good friend. I know the anguish this breeds and it is so hard on your body. Luckily for me my mass changed in the 6 days between my mammogram/ultrasound to the day I had my biopsy, which was yesterday, it turned out to be benign and just an infection. I have never been one to believe in the man upstairs until I prayed for my Christmas miracle, I did not know what to do, and it would seem he answered me.
good luck to you both and I pray you have the same graces I did.
God Bless and Happy New year!!
Posts.Title: Safe to wait a month to biopsy suspiscous spot?

Posts.Content:
I have been thinking about
 you Vita1 how are you holding up and what did you find out?
Posts.Title: Biopsy Anxiety--How to Deal with It?

Posts.Content:
Vita1 and all you other beautiful women!!
I just wanted to check in and see how everyone was doing with there scares and their concerns. I went in last friday for my final ultrasound to see if my infection was gone and it is! there is actually no evidence anything was ever even wrong, thank god. 
I know the plight and worry many of you are going through, anti anxiety medicines are your best friend through this. Prayer is a wonderful tool, but I found the best thing to do is get out, do something you really enjoy and get your mind off of life as much as possible. I think about
 what it was like for myself and say a prayer for all the women out there having to go through this.
Vita1 I am so happy to see you are here and helping others as well i think it may give some a ray of hope to be here and know that no one has to go through this alone.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Anxiety--How to Deal with It?
